definition.title: What are Cochlear Implants?
definition.content: Cochlear implants are medical devices designed to help individuals with severe to profound hearing loss by bypassing the damaged part of the inner ear and directly stimulating the auditory nerve. Unlike traditional hearing aids, which amplify sound, cochlear implants are surgically implanted and can restore a sense of hearing to those with profound hearing loss.

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: For those with severe to profound hearing loss who do not benefit from traditional hearing aids, cochlear implants may be an effective solution. The process involves surgical implantation of the device, followed by programming and adjustments to optimize results.
